page.title: 07Leeswood-Local History
page.content: Since the beginning of the 20th century the Leewood area has changed in many ways; shops for instance.This was a well-supplied village with a Co-op store and three village shops. Sometimes a horse and cart from Mold would come and deliver orders which had been placed the week before. Local employment was plentiful with the colleries and iron works.Not many women worked until a clothing factory opened in Leeswood.In the 1980's more women work in Leeswood than men. People walked until the pushbikes came out and everyone relied on them. Rich people owned most horses and carts. Holidays were not abroad.Summer holidays were usually spent in Rhyl. Children only had holidays when the school term had ended.
